name: Locked in the Labyrinth
description:
Falling into an all-consuming Labyrinth, and meeting a mysterious new friend, embark on a short journey to break free from the twisted maze.

I'll put the controls here in case it's not clear in the tutorial:

  • Movement - WASD and Left Stick
  • Camera - Mouse and Right Stick
  • Sprint - Left Shift and 'B' button
  • Jump - Space and 'A' button
  • Interact/Talk - Enter and 'Y' button
  • Next line of conversation - Enter, 'Y' button, Left Control and 'A' Button
  • Punch - 'Q' key and 'X' button
  • Aim Magic - Right Mouse button, ALT key and Left Trigger button
  • Fire Magic - Left Mouse button, CTRL key and Right Trigger button
  • Change Magic - Scroll Wheel and D-pad

There is a tutorial segment that teaches you this, but I just wanted to be clear, just in case.

How my game fits the theme of Locked in:

You are literally locked in the Labyrinth, and your goal is to escape, I decided to try and focus on both Character and lore because I knew I wouldn't be able to make a very interesting story. I had wanted to try and make it all lore based, having it as a sort of mystery of what the Labyrinth is, which I think I conveyed.

I would have left it at just lore, but the way I implemented it, through conversation, naturally added to creating character based narrative design. So I decided to make the characters and their personality and then have them tell the lore, their version of it to show how the lore isn't just the history, but how the characters have grown into this history, what they know of their history and all.

I also tried to implement the "Joker" optional theme, however I'm not exactly the funniest, so I don't know how it sounds.

I hope you enjoy the game.
